reviews.review_msg: She sends me spiraling into the great beyond. Might develop a drinking problem from her class.
Houston it's boots the house mother is deceased
She is nice, will help you when you reach out and the course was structured well.

Extremely disorganized and provided no clear guidelines for assignments/exams. Refused to fix a very obviously incorrect question on the midterm even after using the textbook as a reference. Definitely the worst experience I have had with a professor at sfu.

In conclusion, my experience with Dr. Sun was one of the worst I've had throughout my academic journey. Their lack of teaching skills, indifference toward student learning, and poor organization made the entire chemistry course a dreadful experience.

Dr.Sun is not a terrible prof. The only thing that wasn't good was when she didn't go over calculations but rather said "look at the slides after class, the calculations are very logical". Exams were fair. Know how to solve homework questions and iclicker questions for exams. This class isn't easy by any means - regardless of which prof teaches it.
Just avoid it for god's sake. I am teaching everything to myself now before final because lectures were absolutely useless and nothing taught properly.

yeah if u have the chance to take a class w/ bing im tellin you to hold off till there is another prof teaching the class. be prepared to learn the material on ur own. nothing is clear about her way of teaching. also there is no room to even ask for extra explanation without her getting upset. its truly sad that sfu is allowing her ways of teaching

She was a very tough grader, did not give proper feedback to why something was inaccurate on the exam. Hard to reach out to her as she should always redirect you to TAs and is not knowledgeable in what is expected for lab reports. Unclear on what is expected since instructions from TA and from her are different. Don't take this class with her.

she was the worst prof I've ever had. She was never available not even 10 minutes after class. The lectures are copied down from textbook and homework solutions directly from the solution manual. She did not even bother typing the solutions, instead took screenshots from mannual. Very rude and negative.

Genuinely hated every minute of this class. She took an interesting topic and made me never wanna look at it again. So incredibly disorganized! Youre just paying money to take a course to fully teach yourself and get the biggest headache in the process.

She is very disorganized, goes through lecture VERY fast, sometimes its difficult to read because she uses the chalkboard. The best way to do well and pass this course is to do the textbook questions AND exercises in her notes. She actually used the same exam as the practice exam she gave us which was VERY surprising.

IDK what to even say. Can be a good teacher but isn't. Disorganized, unclear, and just not worth it in my opinion. You CAN still get a good grade in this class, but you won't have an easy time and you'll be teaching yourself.

Yeah forget about going to lecture because you won't learn a thing. This class was harder than any class I've ever taken; everybody did poorly and it was curved by at least 15%. I failed the lecture but still got a C+ lol
I guess they let anyone get PhDs and become proffs now

Starts off fine, likes everyone, Iclicker quizzes were 5% and she would use it as a way to check where students are at a particular concept. gets annoyed when she sees the I clicker results show 80% of the people picking the wrong answer. She intends to help by using the white board, people sitting in the back cant see, "incoherent in everything"

Speaks quietly, in broken English with a thick Chinese accent.  Lecture notes have no content. useless for review. She "reads" the homework answers to the class. Which means she talks into her piece of paper without using equations/diagrams to illustrate points. When she does make notes on the board they are cluttered and incoherent. Avoid.
a very knowledgeable prof
I like her~ she is very nice~
she is a good prof and i really like her!
easy class, exams are fair and easy. tells you what you need to know for exams - attend lectures! and book questions usually show up in the exams. Wouldnt mind taking another class with her
Awful class. Professor talks with a thick accent and always tries to give life lessons and fails to teach anything. Total hypocrite about things as well and sometimes childish about disagreements.
Really great professor, will take another course with her.
have a hard time in the class but my advice is hire a tutor instead.

All around awful class. No notes were posted. Lectures contained unrelated information. Constantly lectured us on how we were bad students. Did not provide problem sets or answers. Harsh marker. My lowest mark at SFU yet!
The class was so bad that she has to major scale all of our grade. Im happy that i pass at the end.
only picture in lecture notes, lecture focus with his personal knowledge which is not relevant with course. pop quizes almost every class. and no idea whats going to be on the midterm
strong accent. never have time for extra help. every class quiz. have a hard time in this class.
should avoid her because she does not post notes and expect a lot
The worst prof I've ever seen. so disorganize and not helpful.
